title: IERC721 Interface function definition in different order than official EIP721 documentation
body:
<!-- Briefly describe the issue you're experiencing. Tell us what you were trying to do and what happened instead. -->
This is a super small change : the [official Ethereum EIP721 documentation](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721) maintains a slightly different order in function definitions from the [OpenZeppelin IERC721 definition](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC721/IERC721.sol). As a developer trying to validate the OpenZeppelin contract matched the official EIP guidelines side-by-side, it would be a better dev experience if the order of the function definitions were perfectly matched. 

<!-- Remember, this is not a place to ask for help debugging code. For that, we welcome you in the OpenZeppelin Community Forum: https://forum.openzeppelin.com/. -->

**üíª Environment**

<!-- Tell us what version of OpenZeppelin Contracts you're using, and how you're using it: Truffle, Remix, etc. -->
Version : latest. N/A for the rest of the setup

**üìù Details**

<!-- Describe the problem you have been experiencing in more detail. Include as much information as you think is relevant. Keep in mind that transactions can fail for many reasons; context is key here. -->
The official EIP721 documentation defines the functions of the ERC721 Interface in a different order from the OpenZeppelin interface definition. This is a request for a small change to allow developers to scan the OpenZeppelin contract side-by-side with the official EIP721 a bit smoother. 

EIP721 order : Transfer > Approval > ApprovalForAll > balanceOf > ownerOf > safeTransferFrom(with Data) > safeTransferFrom > transferFrom > approve > setApprovalForAll > getApproved > isApprovedForAll 

OpenZeppelin IERC721 order : Transfer > Approval > ApprovalForAll > balanceOf > ownerOf > safeTransferFrom > transferFrom > approve > getApproved > setApprovalForAll > isApprovedForAll > safeTransferFrom(with Data) 


**üî¢ Code to reproduce bug**

<!-- We will be able to better help if you provide a minimal example that triggers the bug. -->
N/A - compare [EIP721 documentation](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721) side by side with [OpenZeppelin IERC721 definition](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC721/IERC721.sol)
Hi devs I am creating this (intentionally small) issue because I want to start contributing and I think this would be a good first easy PR :)
